findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `changeTax` function with a high percentage value.

findings.title: MWV - Multisig Wallet Vulnerability
findings.description: The implementation of the multisig wallet functionality in the contract grants any authorized owner the authority to add or remove authorized wallets by utilizing the `addOwner` and `removeOwner` methods, respectively. This is possible due to the mutability of `numConfirmationsRequired` variable, as described in detail at the MWR section.

findings.title: MWR - Multisig Wallet Requirements
findings.description: The implementation of the multisig wallet functionality has a severe flaw that compromises its intended security, allowing the `numConfirmationsRequired` variable to be modified and set to a minimum of 1, effectively bypassing the whole purpose of having a multisig mechanism.

findings.title: MFI - Misleading Function Implementation
findings.description: The `eventParticipate` function provides a fee-free transfer mechanism for tokens. Given the presence of both options within the contract, users might opt to utilize this function for their token transfers instead of the designated `transfer` or `transferFrom` functions. Consequently, the fee mechanism could potentially lose its relevance.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: RCS - Redundant Conditional Statement
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized. A segment may be optimized so that it becomes a smaller size, consumes less memory, executes more rapidly, or performs fewer operations.

findings.title: HLI - Holders List Inconsistency
findings.description: The current implementation of the contract lacks consistency between the `holders` list and the `dexAddressList`, which can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function which is redundant as view functions do not modify the state of the contract and do not perform any actions that cost gas.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.
